action.action-desc: Mr. Foster introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Oversight and Government Reform

form.official-title: To assess the State by State impact of Federal taxation and spending.

section.text:
This Act may be cited as the
Payer State Transparency Act of 2014
.

section.header: Calculation of Federal Tax Burdens and Outlays

subsection.header: State by State Calculation of Federal tax burdens

paragraph.text: The Secretary of Commerce, acting through the Director of the Bureau of Economic Analysis, shall calculate the Federal tax burden of each State for each fiscal year.
For purposes of calculating the Federal tax burden of each State under paragraph (1), the Secretary shall—

subparagraph.text: account for variations in monthly Federal tax receipts from each State; and

treat Federal taxes paid by an individual as a burden on the State in which such individual resides and treat Federal taxes paid by a legal business entity as a burden on the State in which the primary economic activity of such entity is performed.

subsection.header: State by State Calculation of Federal Outlays

paragraph.text: The Director of the Office of Management and Budget, in coordination with the Council of Economic Advisers and the Secretary of the Treasury, shall calculate the total amount of Federal outlays received by each State in each fiscal year.

For purposes of calculating the amount of Federal outlays received by a State under paragraph (1), a Federal contract award shall be treated as a Federal outlay received by the State in which the primary performance under the award takes place.

subsection.text: In this section the term State means each of the several States.

section.text: Not later than the date that is 90 days after the first day of each fiscal year beginning after the date of the enactment of this Act the Secretary of Commerce and the Director of the Office of Management and Budget shall—

paragraph.text: jointly submit to Congress a report containing the results of the calculations described in section 2 with respect to the previous fiscal year; and
publish the report on a publicly accessible website of the Bureau of Economic Analysis.
